message.content:
To start playing chess with me, first mention the initial position of the piece you'd like to move and then its destination. For example: "move pawn from e2 to e4" or simply use this notation: "e2 e4".

Remember that there are 8 ranks (rows) labeled as numbers (1-8), and 8 files (columns) labeled as letters (a-h). When moving a piece, always indicate the file letter followed by the rank number.

Here is an overview of all pieces:

- King (K): one per player
- Queen (Q): one per player
- Rook (R): two per player
- Bishop(B): two per player
- Knight(N/Kt):: two per player
- Pawn(P/Pawn):: eight per player

The starting position in a standard game should look like this:

White:
Pawn - Pawns on each square of row/rank 2.
Knight - One knight on b1, another on g1.
Bishop - One bishop on c1, another on f1.
Rook - One rook at a1 and h9 
Queen - The white queen goes on d1.
King - The king goes next to it at e1 

Black :: same but opposite. Starting from eighth rank towards down. pawns @ seventh rank.

Now it's your turn! Please type your move using either regular English text or chess notation format :)
